title: CAA champion Christ School still unbeaten
text:

Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs CAA champion Christ School still unbeaten Andrew Pearson , apearson@citizen-times.com 9:48 a.m. EDT October 18, 2015 
Christ School's Cal Jansen. (Photo: CHRIST SCHOOL) 
For the second consecutive Saturday, the Christ School soccer team left no doubt in a pivotal Carolinas Athletic Association game. 
Cal Jansen's scored his 12th goal of the season and Riley Smith added two in the second half of a 3-0 shutout at Asheville Christian Academy. 
The Greenies (11-0-4) are not only the outright CAA champions by virtue of the win, but the sport's last undefeated team left in Western North Carolina. Will Iorio was the goalkeeper responsible for the shutout â€” he was also in the net Oct. 13 when Christ School beat ACA at home, 3-0. 
Christ School plays Monday at Greensboro Day and then wraps up the regular season Tuesday at home against Rabun Gap (Ga.). The Greenies are the third-ranked team in NCISAA 3-A soccer.
